solution_line_template: {total_huskies_pitbulls} huskies and pitbulls had {pups_per_husky_pitbull} pups each for a total of {pups_per_husky_pitbull}*{total_huskies_pitbulls} = <<{total_huskies_pitbulls}*{pups_per_husky_pitbull}={pups_from_huskies_pitbulls}>>{pups_from_huskies_pitbulls} pups

Each golden retriever had {golden_retriever_more_pups} more pups each than the huskies who had {pups_per_husky_pitbull} each so each golden retriever had {pups_per_husky_pitbull}+{golden_retriever_more_pups} = <<{pups_per_husky_pitbull}+{golden_retriever_more_pups}={pups_per_golden_retriever}>>{pups_per_golden_retriever} pups
{num_golden_retrievers} golden retrievers had {pups_per_golden_retriever} pups each for a total of {pups_from_golden_retrievers} pups
There are a total of {pups_from_huskies_pitbulls}+{pups_from_golden_retrievers} = <<{pups_from_huskies_pitbulls}+{pups_from_golden_retrievers}={total_pups}>>{total_pups} pups
There are a total of {num_huskies}+{num_pitbulls}+{num_golden_retrievers} = <<{num_huskies}+{num_pitbulls}+{num_golden_retrievers}={total_adult_dogs}>>{total_adult_dogs} adult dogs
There are {total_pups}-{total_adult_dogs} = <<{total_pups}-{total_adult_dogs}={more_pups_than_adults}>>{more_pups_than_adults} more pups than adult dogs
